ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Are you going to be left secure amid what is here,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (Do you think) you will be left secure here
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Do you believe that you will be left here to live securely in the present state
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Do you think that you will remain here peacefully forever
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Will you be left peacefully in these favours over here?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Will you be left secure in that which you have here"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Will you be left secure in what is here;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Will you be left secure in this here,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Will ye be left secure in that which is here before us,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Do you think that you will be left secure [forever] --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Shall ye be left secure in that which is here before us.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Will you be left secure in that which is here
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Will ye be left secure, in (the enjoyment of) all that ye have here?-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Will you be left secure in that which you have here?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Will you be left secure in this,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Will you be left secure in what is here?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:146] Will you be left secure in that which is here, of good things —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Will ye be left secure) from death, cessation or punishment (in that which is here before us) of bounties,
